stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Christina was very unclear in what she wanted us to do in this class. She changed her rubrics around halfway through the quarter. It was really geared towards the people who went on the Quebec trip with her this summer. She was great in a previous class that I had with her so I was excited going into this class, but that quickly changed.

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Christina\'s phonetics class is so fun!! Her lectures are so engaging and she genuinely cares about her students and their learning. This class was tougher than usual for me because while I normally excel in French, phonetics is like learning an entirely new language! But it\'s awesome and doable. She is a fair grader and sometimes lets you redo.

comments: Christina is great, super outgoing and interested in the students. Having Christina as a professor made having this class at 8am less awful. The course is interesting, slightly difficult, and requires work, but Christina is an awesome resource and works to make sure that every student can succeed. Definitely recommend her!

comments: She is amazing! She knows how to teach the language even though they are so many students in one class.

comments: Christina is a life saver!!! She truly is an amazing woman and teacher. She shows that she really cares about her students academically and emotionally alike. Rarely lectures, uses activities to help with grammar and vocab.

comments: Amazing French professor! Take any class you can from her. She is cool and kind and really likes to work one-on-one. My 203 class was 15 people and it was great because she\'d get to know us so well. Not necessarily easy, but if you\'re willing to learn French it is

comments: I dreaded this class every day. I wonder why this is a requirement for the French major, or a class at all. I wanted to be interested, but talking with her felt impossible. She\'s informal, touches students fondly, but I really hate classes *this* loose. Seemed like the kind of teacher who would sit backwards in a chair and say, "let\'s get real."

comments: Christina is a wonderful teacher. She really cares about her students on a personal level(even in a 101 class). I would take her again any day! Definitely recommended.

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Christina is one of the best professors I\'ve ever had. I had her for LING 204 and liked her so much that I took her for French 101 again. She\'s extremely helpful, fair, and funny. Her classes aren\'t easy but she is an excellent professor. I highly recommend her.

comments: Keppie is a great teacher and the work is pretty straightforward with clear grading rubrics for each assignment. Participation and attendance is necessary because it\'s a phonetics class. She is a very understanding teacher in regards to personal life troubles (sickness, death in family, etc.). Overall 1010

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Her exams were not difficult if you studied and read the textbook, honestly. What made the class difficult was the amount of busy work she had us do. You have to do the reading, listen to her videos, post on the discussion board and answer questions. She just never stopped giving us work. If you work or have demanding classes, STAY AWAY!!!!!!

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: This class is interesting an easy. The biggest problem with it is that she tries to make it interactive, which in a 150+ student lecture hall is incredibly difficult. Too much time is wasted on pointless group reflection. The class would run a lot smoother if she just lectured, which yes, is boring, but it\'s a 204 lecture hall of course it\'s borinG

comments: Christina is such a wonderful teacher and person. She\'s very caring, genuine, and so funny. She gives you a lot of opportunity in class to absorb the material and practice speaking (which is part of your grade, so raise your hand a lot!).

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: She sounded a little snobby at first to me, but she is excellent at getting everyone interested and mediate heated discussions in the class. She is very very enthusiastic about the subject, and I think for this class she is the best. She is always ready help you also.

comments: She\'s so entertaining and enthusiastic! A great way to start the day, even at 8am! She is passionate about linguistics and French.

comments: Dr. Keppie is super sweet and makes an 8am class bearable. The topics covered in class are interesting, but tests are fairly difficult. Grade based on 3 tests, responses to 4 movies, and a final group project (no final test)

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: This is one of the best classes I have taken so far at WWU. Keppie is enthusiastic & funny and makes the material interesting and fairly simple. I would love to take a class with her again! Highly reccommend

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: The class was very useful and what made me decide to major in linguisitcs. She gave 2 tests which were fairly difficult. Instead of a final she has a final presentation which is done in a group and a lot of fun. She has blackboard posts due the Friday after every movie and that is what got me a few times (forgetting those) but great professor!

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I did not enjoy this class. She taught the class verbatim and I felt like I was back in high school. She dressed revealingly which made it hard to take her seriously as a professor. I don\'t like her attitude during office hours.

tag_professor: Caring (7)  Participation matters (4)  Gives good feedback (3)  Hilarious (3)  Respected (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  GROUP PROJECTS (1)  Inspirational (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Christina really knows her stuff. After taking Ling 201, some TESOL classes, phonetics with Keppie has been the most fun learning about languages! If you go to class everyday and do all the homework, you\'ll do just fine. Participate! That\'s the only way you\'ll get better. Very helpful, I recommend her for any level of French.
